name: creakiness
content:
creakiness noun [U]
(MAKING SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality or condition of being likely to make a long, low sound when moved: Aging is not just a matter of creakiness in the joints. Can we do anything about the creakiness of the floorboards?
More examplesFewer examplesDespite the creakiness of the vehicle, we got to our destination.There is still some creakiness in his injured shoulder.A little oil will cure the creakiness of the hinges.

creakiness noun [U]
(OLD-FASHIONED)
the quality of being old-fashioned and not now effective: The enterprise was undermined by the creakiness of the technology used to implement it.
More examplesFewer examplesA flu crisis exposed the creakiness of the health service.The creakiness of the plot is all too evident.Despite the creakiness of the material, the production was enjoyable enough.A certain creakiness has set in to the process.
